jobs.title: Helper
jobs.description: As a Helper, you will play a crucial role in supporting our CDL drivers in the efficient and safe transportation of goods. Your assistance and attention to detail will contribute to the overall success of our logistics operations.
responsibilities: Assisting CDL drivers in loading, unloading, and transporting goods.
Ensuring the safe and secure handling of cargo during loading and unloading processes.
Following instructions from CDL drivers regarding the organization and placement of goods within the vehicle.
Checking and verifying the accuracy of goods being loaded or unloaded.
Operating equipment and tools necessary for loading and unloading activities, such as forklifts, pallet jacks, or hand trucks.
Maintaining cleanliness and orderliness of the work area, including the vehicle and loading docks.
Collaborating with CDL drivers to ensure timely and efficient transportation of goods.
Monitoring and reporting any issues or damages related to the cargo or equipment.
Adhering to safety regulations and procedures at all times.
Assisting in the inspection and maintenance of vehicles and equipment used in the transportation process.
Providing support to CDL drivers as needed during the transportation journey.
Communicating effectively with team members and supervisors to ensure smooth operations.

jobs.title: CDL Driver
jobs.description: Pickup and deliver roll off dumpsters. Adhere to safety policies and directions. Cleans loose trash off of truck and/or ground around truck and container that spills during dumping process to maintain clean customer site and safety along roads and highways.
qualifications: High School Diploma or GED Preferred
Must be able to submit and pass a DOT pre-employment drug test
Two Years or Equivalent Commercial Truck Driving Experience Required
Valid Class A or B CDL with Air Brakes Required
No More than One Moving Violation or Accident (within last 36 months)
No Suspensions or Revocations due to a Moving Violation or Accident, and No DUI /DWI Infractions (within last 36 months)
responsibilities: Drive and operate trucks
Follow instructions, locate and read location road maps
Pre-inspect truck
Pick up goods and materials, verify loads for accuracy, and deliver them as instructed
Load and unload cargo
Responsible for basic vehicle maintenance; comply with all safe work practices, policies, and processes at all times

jobs.title: Maintenance Technician
jobs.description: We are seeking a skilled Maintenance Technician to join our team. As a Maintenance Technician, you will play a crucial role in maintaining and repairing vehicles and equipment.
responsibilities: Works under limited supervision and selects from written instructions and established procedures to accomplish assigned tasks
Performs repairs and assigned preventive maintenance services
Performs inspection, diagnosis and repair of electrical, hydraulic, suspension, brake and air systems on vehicles and equipment
Utilizes vehicle computer electronics systems to interpret failure modes to initiate or assign repairs
Estimates time and material costs on vehicle repairs and requisitions new parts
Performs all work within Standard Repair Times (SRTs)
Performs service calls for emergency breakdowns
Conducts safety checks on vehicles
Completes required paperwork utilizing fleet maintenance software program associated with repairing vehicles, documenting parts usage, and accounting for repair times
Assists senior technicians in the completion of project work
Reviews, completes or assigns repairs identified on Driver Vehicle Inspection Reports
Maintains a clean, safe work area in compliance with Corporate / OSHA Standards, and performs all work in accordance with established safety procedures
